intro: Verbascum acutifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mullein, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in the summer, which are clustered in a cylindrical shape at the top of the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Verbascum acutifolium is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its soothing effects.
